page.title: 07Bideford:S+SE.Plant Survey.
page.content: Plants and rubbish were examined,along -side the unclassified road ,passing close to the mature woodland threatened by the Ford House Tourist site.From the unofficial passing place at the top of the hill (O.S.452255),and walking towar -ds Bideford,a 30 metre section of ver- ge was studied,on 12.7.1985.Much of the rubbish(crisp and cigarette packets, sweet and pork-pie wrappers,serviettes ,cans and paper cups)seemed to come from picnickers;the rest suggested ho- use and building refuse(plastic junk,me -tal sheet,bricks,wallpaper,seat covers )except for two prize items the remains of a car and ? a railway carriage.These plants were found:-Stinging Nettle,Bram -ble,Dog Rose,Honeysuckle,Vetch,Dock, Red Campion,Agrimony,Crane's Bill,Penny Wort,Ivy,Goose Grass,Dandelion,HedgePar -sley,Convulvulus,Nipple Wort,Plantain, Musk Thistle,Hawthorn,and Strap Fern.
